headline: Can this old fella get the nomination, if his beliefs are an abomination?

utterances.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW, ANCHOR, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: Joining us now is Congresswoman Maxine Waters, Democratic California, Chair of the Financial Services Committee. Chairwoman Waters, thank you so much for being here tonight. It's really nice to have you here.

utterances.speaker: REP. MAXINE WATERS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: She's cutting out.

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Oh no.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Can you can you hear me Madam Chair?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Not that well.

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Uh-oh. Here's what we're going to do. We're going to take a quick break. I'm going to send a bunch of elves over to you to fix the audio and then we'll be back with you in just a moment. We believe we have fixed our technical gremlins. Madam Chair, can you hear me?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Barely.

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, well, I'll talk loud. We'll hopefully work this out.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know what's happening.

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, dear. Well, let me try this. Madam Chair, you've been asking for documents and testimony from Deutsche Bank as it pertains to President Trump, basically since he was sworn in. What are you interested in here? What is it that you're investigating there?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Rachel, would you repeat that one more time?

utterances.speaker: MADDOW
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I'm surprised she didn't blame the Russians.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a bad week for the activist press. Smollett, Sandmann, Laura Logan -- the three horsemen of the media apocalypse. They got every reporter pulling out their hair. Well, except for this guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think he's already moved on to his back. First, there's Nick suing the "Washington Post" for 250 million bucks. It's a lot of money. But think about how much money they made off smearing him. The paper makes 100 million bucks of digital ad sales alone. That's a lot of money, a hundred million dollars. That's more than I make in a year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How do they make all that money? Conflict - which brings eyeballs, which makes money, so I say Nick Sandmann, get your piece, you earned it. Without you, how would Chris Cuomo afford his daily waxing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: At least daily. Now there's Smollett. Like Covington, it began with media ready conflict spiraling into a hate tornado directed at the usual suspects, which is you. Remember, Covington was a white brat in a red hat. Smollett also tapped that hat. Sadly, it turns out his white racists were Nigerian bodybuilders. Check out this pair. Their abs have abs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They've got more muscles than a mollusk convention. If I had access to those washboards, I'd be doing laundry every night of the week. Smollett paid them 3,500 bucks to pull off this stunt, yet he makes 60 grand a show. So forget that he's a hoaxter. He's just a cheap [bleep].

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now these cases along with the Brett Kavanaugh smear, they need to be part of a course. Call it Journalistic Ethics, something to take instead of Intersectional Gender Studies and I know who should teach it.

utterances.speaker: LAURA LOGAN, JOURNALIST
utterances.sentences: The media everywhere is mostly liberal, not just in the U.S., but in this country, 85% of journalists are registered Democrats. So that's just a fact, right. No one is registering Democrats when there are rarely a Republican, so the facts are on the side of what you just stated, most journalists are left or liberal or Democrat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Talk about speaking truth to power, which is why no one covered it, but us, because when the news embarrasses the news industry, it disappears faster than Taylor Swift's boyfriends. Because once the Emperor's New Clothes are exposed, don't expect the Emperor to tell you about it. The Emperor is busy blaming Fox for eating people's lunches.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: Sean Hannity is going to eat Jussie Smollett's lunch every single second. Tucker Carlson is going to eat Jussie Smollett's lunch every single second. The President of the United States is going to eat his lunch --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm getting hungry. So that's the concern. We're going to dine on Smollett, no Lemon, we're dining on you. You believed him because you already believe Donald Trump supporters were racist. Smollett served a purpose for you and you served a purpose for him.  Smollett saw the media for what it was -- suckers -- and I kind of admire it. But if you're only lesson is that Smollett was being used by us as fodder while missing the fact that he made you look like a dumb ass then you truly are a lemon. Since 2016, these media fail moments have been piling up and the same culprits are at the scene of every crime. It's the activist media, journalists driven by an agenda and the profit maker behind this machine is always conflict.

utterances.speaker: RYAN YOUNG, NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT, CNN
utterances.sentences: The idea that racial slurs, and maybe even some of the homophobic slurs being used toward him. You can see how serious this crime is right now.

utterances.speaker: BROOKE BALDWIN, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely despicable.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Smollett in real life is black and gay, which may have been the motivation for a possible hate crime against him in Chicago.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm disgusted by people who wear hats that same MAGA.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't believe Jussie is making this up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't like that it's being put out there in the media that this is a "possible" hate crime.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.sentences: This is America in 2019.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You wish. Celebs also dove in placing the blame where it belonged. Of course, on Pence.

utterances.speaker: ELLEN PAGE, CANADIAN ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: It feels impossible to not feel this way right now with the President and the Vice President Mike Pence who like wishes I couldn't be married. Let's just be clear. Connect the dots. This is what happens. If you we're in a position of power and you hate people and you want to cause suffering to them. You go through the trouble. You spend your career trying to cause suffering. What do you think is going to happen?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She should know. I tried to sit through her last movie. That's suffering.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anyway, I wonder if Colbert will have her back on to discuss how Pence didn't help create a crime that didn't exist. Meanwhile, we all here held our tongues even though the story stank like the bathroom after curry night at the rest home. I mean, Trump supporters stalking the Chicago streets in subzero temperatures at 2:00 am carrying a noose running into some nobody actor on a show they don't watch and somehow recognizing him? Then beating him up without taking his wallet, phone or sandwich.  This seems it's possible. It's me being hired as a babysitter. They didn't even take a sandwich. This seemed as possible as me being hired as a babysitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They didn't even take his sandwich. It was a Subway and they're delicious. Maybe that Smollett's next gig, Subway spokesman. It's a step up from Jared. By the way, he paid the Nigerians with a check. I mean, who still writes checks? Maybe your aunt on your birthday? Thanks for the card, Aunt Edna and the $10.00, but Smollett was the perfect victim for a media that wanted this so badly to be true. So why are these hoaxes so common? Here's my thinking. All of those folks who went to college in the last decade or so are now employed in the media, and they brought with them the victimhood virus they were infected with on campus. The virus makes you stupid, na<ve, gullible, did I say stupid? Yes, I did. Anyway, some people are sad Smollett was a hoax. Not me, I'm always thrilled when a hate crime turns out to be false.  Which means I'm thrilled a lot. It means that we aren't as racist as the media wants us to be. And we live in a country where hate crimes have to be made up because the demand for hate crimes exceeds the supply. But if you're still sad, this was a hoax, it is only because it exposes how your activist bias set you up as a willing stooge. The media owns this story. It's like they took a course on it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Attention news professionals. Do the traditions of objective reporting bore you? Are you hungry for the profits that come with agenda driven headlines? Then send your journalist to the Blame, Insinuate Accuse Seminar.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, HOST
utterances.sentences: Now, I'm going to show you some headlines and you're going tell me how you would rewrite them for maximum profit. Okay, here's the first one. "Snow storm expected to blanket North East."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: "Whites ski the rest freeze as snowstorm reveals weather inequality."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Nice. All right, here's another one. "Midwest man wins Mega Millions jackpot."

utterances.speaker: SALLY
utterances.sentences: Oh, "Man wins lottery -- No surprise to the 3.2 billion women who didn't win the lottery."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Snappy. I love it. Sally, you're a natural. All right. How about this one. "World War II vet celebrates 95th birthday."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: "Elderly white lifelong Republican voter turns 95 thanks to Russian collusion."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Nailed it. All right. Next one. "Church youth group holds bake sale for flood victims."

utterances.speaker: SALLY
utterances.sentences: "Extremists use religion to poison victims with heart-clogging toxins."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. Okay. "Multi-car accident on Toronto freeway."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: "Multi-car accident on Toronto freeway only in Trump's America."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: "House fire in Australia injure seven house."

utterances.speaker: SALLY
utterances.sentences: "House Fire in Australia injure seven only in Trump's America."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: "Volcano erupts in Brazil, many injured."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: "Volcano erupts in Brazil. Many injured only in Trump's America."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, you all passed with flying colors. I am so proud of you. Now get out there and do some journalism.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's the Blame, Insinuate, Accuse Seminar -- locations everywhere. Call today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If your symptoms are chronic, he's got the tonic. Host of the radio show "Dr. Drew Midday Live," Dr. Drew Pinsky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This man really got Bin Laden to open up. Former Navy SEAL, Rob O'Neill.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She is only happy when she's feeling crappy. Host of "The Tyrus and Timpf Podcast," Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And the last time he blew out birthday candles, they had to call the Fire Department, former WWE superstar, massive sidekick, host of "UnPC," Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dr. Drew, you're a doctor or so you say, I haven't actually seen your diploma. Has America turned into one big church of victimhood? What's going on? DREW PINSKY, HOST, "DR. PINSKY MIDDAY LIVE": Not only that, we have such - - we get such credibility from being a victim, people want to be a certain kind of victim so badly we're actually seeing a little epidemic of these kinds of hoaxes. They all have the same kind of construct to them, which is people want to be a victim of these things because it gives them status.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, it's actually - for this guy it's better to be a victim than actually a being a star of a show. That's insane.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: It's strange how -- however, I've been doing a lot of thinking about this guy. He had an album dropping like a day after this whole thing, and it was all about exactly what happened to him in Chicago. And I wonder if there was something. Even he -- listen to this, even he was shocked at how crazy the media got with the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I think that might be the case.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Rob, what's your take on this?

utterances.speaker: ROB O'NEILL, FORMER NAVY SEAL
utterances.sentences: I am a straight white kid from Beau, Montana who could probably be on the cover of "Decent Shape" magazine. So I have never -- I have never been the victim of a hate crime. I've never seen it. But for someone to -- it's one thing to screw up, which I don't think happened. It's another thing to make it happen. A hoax like this that takes away from actual hate crimes where real violence in Chicago is a problem, real people who are gay or transgender getting beat up. It's a shame because now, was this real? Or is someone making this up? And I don't think personally, he did it like they're saying for salary. I think he did this because he hated Trump so much. Maybe we can make them all racist to make people hate Trump more. It just -- I mean, it might sound ridiculous. But how ridiculous. I'm impressed that he got beat up and held on to his sandwich.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.sentences: I mean, I've been in fights before. That's the first thing I'd drop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Although I would -- I would beat them with the meat.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.sentences: Well played, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way. That can't be policed. Thank you. Kat, I'm being applauded for some strange sentence.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No, I'm just - this whole thing confuses me. I love attention. Like, I love it so much that it pushes people away. However, I don't fake a racist, homophobic attack on myself love attention. Like, hasn't he heard of just like posting a selfie on Instagram? Or like starting a fight with your boyfriend? Or pretending to be pregnant? These are all better ways. Or maybe like learning to ride a unicycle because you know what? That's the only reason anyone learns to ride a unicycle, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They have invented bikes with two wheels.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. That is true. We're going to -- don't sit -- unicycle writers, send the letters to Kat.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You're doing it for the attention, guys. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST, FOX NATION: Yes, all four of you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Smearing the unicyclists. Tyrus, what are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Besides the fact that you literally -- great monologue, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: But you certainly got really creepy in there. Literally, every time you made a great point, he slid in something creepy. Did anyone stuck on the whole, "Don't let me babysit your kids," was that a mission? A cry for help? Like, what the hell, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate kids.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.sentences: Hey, Tyrus, that was as creepy as him saying he is going to beat the meat out of my sandwich.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: That's what I am saying like he will say something like, "You know, we should all be unified together, and then unify in my basement." Like he says really creepy things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's my thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And this is my segue. We don't have the explosion from, you know, "Tyrus and Timpf" but if you subscribe.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Podcast.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Nice plug.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I was - I talk to Dr. Drew a lot about this, Dr. D -- you said, I'd call you that. I was trying to figure out why he did this. Why did he -- they mentioned salary and this whatever. And I've actually witnessed this behavior quite often in my own life in my own home. My four-year-old daughter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: She'll be running in the yard back and forth and I'll be having to do work yeah, maybe watching ESPN report on my phone or whatever. And she'll fall. Like, "Uh, Daddy my leg," and I'll be like, "Oh, what happened?" A shark.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And then will look at me and I'm like, "A shark." "And a dinosaur."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: What do we do? What do we do? "I don't know. They killed me to death." "Oh, my poor baby." And then I give her a hug, and guess what? Where's the shark? "I think they left, daddy. I think we're good now."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She just wanted to hug?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: He did the [bleep] for a hug. He should have paid those guys $3,500.00 to hug on you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, my god.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: How about the check by the way? I think he must need a vinyl also.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Check the vinyl. This maybe a new thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have to roll, but I do believe that it has a lot to do with naivete. The people in media right now are coming from the campus and they can't -- everybody here, Dr. Drew, Rob military, Kat libertarian, Tyrus --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Watch your mouth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus streetwise. None of you believed this story. None of you believed this story --

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Immediately.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But stat people that work at MSNBC and CNN in their newsrooms bought it. They bought it --

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: And ran with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. All right, we've got to move on because we have so much to share with you. It's the return of the burn, and no, we're not talking about that infection I got in Mazatlan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can this old fella get the nomination if his beliefs are an abomination? Add Bernie Sanders to the island of crazy oddities, looking for the Democratic nomination. He's been in politics forever, and hasn't combed his hair in 35 years. Look, Bernie is a white guy in his 70s, which for the Democrats is worse than worshipping Satan. But he almost beat Hillary in the 2016 primary. So maybe he thinks he can get the nomination if she's not running. I mean, who else could do it? Kirsten Gillibrand, who's paying attention to her?

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: I don't think you should back away from the bold ideas that the base and the grassroots care about. Sorry ma'am.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sorry, I just wanted to get some Ranch.

utterances.speaker: GILLIBRAND
utterances.sentences: Sorry, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It would have been better if she had asked Gillibrand for the Ranch. Pro tip, don't ever be the candidate standing in the way of Ranch Dressing. It's the best -- it's the best dressing ever. And what about Joe? He told an audience in Germany that America was an embarrassment. His biggest asset is that he's only stupid. Now, the nomination could end up going to a crunchy old socialist who happens to own three homes. Yes, three homes, that's three more homes than Kat who still lives in a garage?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Damn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but it'd be fun to watch him versus Trump. What do you think Bernie?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And its tendency to focus on side issues.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's a lady who is sure. All that glitters is gold. And she's buying a stairway to heaven.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: People in the audience as they approach the book might be interested in knowing --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When she gets there, she knows if the stores are all closed with the word she can get what she came for.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And I just love you. I want to ask just a couple of things about your early life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, and she's buying Stairway to Heaven.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What will Democrats do now that you are responsible? And in the leadership?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's a sign on the wall, but she wants to be sure because, you know, sometimes words have two meanings.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There are so many people who say young people are only activists, because they are millennials who are idealistic and think it is cool.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I believe, I have gas. Oh, I never should have had that three-bean salad, always comes back. Why not just have two beans, always the three beans. Oh, my God. I hope that's just gas. Maybe they'll think Pelosi did it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right, Rob --

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Does he still have the Mojo that he had in 2016?

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.sentences: Well, everyone is trying to get on board with the socialism thing because they put their name in front of Democratic socialism, which is a bunch of nonsense, too, but I am just saying they were bragging about what? $8 million a few minutes when he announced his candidacy. He better be given 70% of the Trump campaign because let's share the wealth a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.sentences: You know what I am saying? That's what it is all about, and like the $300,000.00 on private airfare last month. It's easy to be a socialist when you're living like a capitalist, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, that's the only way to do it. What do you think, Kat, as a libertarian? Are you scared that this could - we could have a socialist President/

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, I love Bernie supporters. They're like, "I will not rest until every business in the country has zero dollars." I'm sick of it. I'm sick of the Democratic socialist acting like they're so altruistic, like, "Oh, look at us. We want to give you this, you want to give you this, we want to give you this. Not like those mean Republicans. No. They want it you to be sick, and they want you to be hungry. And then they want to kill your grandma. And then they want you to die after you watch grandma die." It's like, no, in order to give you something, you have to actually own that first. They're not giving away their own stuff, right? If your boyfriend takes you out to dinner, and buys you a present ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.sentences: Which happens only now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You would probably be very happy unless you found out that he used your credit card to pay for it --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Which is only acceptable if you are nine and that person is your mother, and you made it on construction paper or whatever. But no, it's -- I'm sick of them pretending that it's about generosity. It's not about generosity. It's about control. It's about big government. And it's about taking from people not giving.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, the illusion is that government services are free and the socialists are actually giving it to you when in fact it's taking from the free market.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's deep. That's great, Greg. The illusion is the media and they go back -- America does not walk around trying to be victims. We talked about it about earlier. The media is painting victims and expect the American people to buy into it and the Smollett thing just prove that we're still not buying that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Bernie Sanders is a legit contender despite CNN and the other left leaning media's best efforts. They are pitching this magnificent Group of Seven young candidates who are coming in. And then Bernie announced and raised $6 million in 24 hours. Then they said, well, let's list how much the other guys made. Kamala, not bad. It took her about a week, she got about $2 million. So she's strong. After that. About $6.00 or $7.00, $16.00. I think Pocahontas owes money. And that goes against their message. It was supposed to be this new left because that's the only way they feel that they can. So you watch how this goes down. This is going to be a boring time for President Trump and I don't know if he is going to be able to handle it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because they're going to be going after Bernie Sanders for everything because he's not what they want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And that's going to be the fun story is how they keep throwing things at Bernie though, all kinds of little stories going to leak about him. There's going to be all these anonymous tips about Bernie's behaviors. And maybe there's a fourth house out there we don't know about. A little bastard house somewhere. I mean, a little cabin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The fourth house in his hair, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Maybe he is out with Greg Gutfeld on weekends. Like we don't, we don't know. But I guarantee you there's going to be some stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I did meet him at a party.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've got to get to Dr. Drew. Last word on this.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: In two years, old white male becomes completely a non-contender. Just being an old white male.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: At least daily. Now there's Smollett. Like Covington, it began with media ready conflict spiraling into a hate tornado directed at the usual suspects, which is you. Remember, Covington was a white brat in a red hat. Smollett also tapped that hat. Sadly, it turns out his white racists were Nigerian bodybuilders. Check out this pair. Their abs have abs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They've got more muscles than a mollusk convention. If I had access to those washboards, I'd be doing laundry every night of the week. Smollett paid them 3,500 bucks to pull off this stunt, yet he makes 60 grand a show. So forget that he's a hoaxter. He's just a cheap [bleep].

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now these cases along with the Brett Kavanaugh smear, they need to be part of a course. Call it Journalistic Ethics, something to take instead of Intersectional Gender Studies and I know who should teach it.

utterances.speaker: LAURA LOGAN, JOURNALIST
utterances.utterance: The media everywhere is mostly liberal, not just in the U.S., but in this country, 85% of journalists are registered Democrats. So that's just a fact, right. No one is registering Democrats when there are rarely a Republican, so the facts are on the side of what you just stated, most journalists are left or liberal or Democrat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Talk about speaking truth to power, which is why no one covered it, but us, because when the news embarrasses the news industry, it disappears faster than Taylor Swift's boyfriends. Because once the Emperor's New Clothes are exposed, don't expect the Emperor to tell you about it. The Emperor is busy blaming Fox for eating people's lunches.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.utterance: Sean Hannity is going to eat Jussie Smollett's lunch every single second. Tucker Carlson is going to eat Jussie Smollett's lunch every single second. The President of the United States is going to eat his lunch --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm getting hungry. So that's the concern. We're going to dine on Smollett, no Lemon, we're dining on you. You believed him because you already believe Donald Trump supporters were racist. Smollett served a purpose for you and you served a purpose for him. Smollett saw the media for what it was -- suckers -- and I kind of admire it. But if you're only lesson is that Smollett was being used by us as fodder while missing the fact that he made you look like a dumb ass then you truly are a lemon. Since 2016, these media fail moments have been piling up and the same culprits are at the scene of every crime. It's the activist media, journalists driven by an agenda and the profit maker behind this machine is always conflict.

utterances.speaker: RYAN YOUNG, NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT, CNN
utterances.utterance: The idea that racial slurs, and maybe even some of the homophobic slurs being used toward him. You can see how serious this crime is right now.

utterances.speaker: BROOKE BALDWIN, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.utterance: Absolutely despicable.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Smollett in real life is black and gay, which may have been the motivation for a possible hate crime against him in Chicago.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'm disgusted by people who wear hats that same MAGA.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I don't believe Jussie is making this up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I don't like that it's being put out there in the media that this is a "possible" hate crime.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: This is America in 2019.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You wish. Celebs also dove in placing the blame where it belonged. Of course, on Pence.

utterances.utterance: It feels impossible to not feel this way right now with the President and the Vice President Mike Pence who like wishes I couldn't be married. Let's just be clear. Connect the dots. This is what happens. If you we're in a position of power and you hate people and you want to cause suffering to them. You go through the trouble. You spend your career trying to cause suffering. What do you think is going to happen?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She should know. I tried to sit through her last movie. That's suffering.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anyway, I wonder if Colbert will have her back on to discuss how Pence didn't help create a crime that didn't exist. Meanwhile, we all here held our tongues even though the story stank like the bathroom after curry night at the rest home. I mean, Trump supporters stalking the Chicago streets in subzero temperatures at 2:00 am carrying a noose running into some nobody actor on a show they don't watch and somehow recognizing him? Then beating him up without taking his wallet, phone or sandwich. This seems it's possible. It's me being hired as a babysitter. They didn't even take a sandwich. This seemed as possible as me being hired as a babysitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They didn't even take his sandwich. It was a Subway and they're delicious. Maybe that Smollett's next gig, Subway spokesman. It's a step up from Jared. By the way, he paid the Nigerians with a check. I mean, who still writes checks? Maybe your aunt on your birthday? Thanks for the card, Aunt Edna and the $10.00, but Smollett was the perfect victim for a media that wanted this so badly to be true. So why are these hoaxes so common? Here's my thinking. All of those folks who went to college in the last decade or so are now employed in the media, and they brought with them the victimhood virus they were infected with on campus. The virus makes you stupid, na<ve, gullible, did I say stupid? Yes, I did. Anyway, some people are sad Smollett was a hoax. Not me, I'm always thrilled when a hate crime turns out to be false. Which means I'm thrilled a lot. It means that we aren't as racist as the media wants us to be. And we live in a country where hate crimes have to be made up because the demand for hate crimes exceeds the supply. But if you're still sad, this was a hoax, it is only because it exposes how your activist bias set you up as a willing stooge. The media owns this story. It's like they took a course on it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Attention news professionals. Do the traditions of objective reporting bore you? Are you hungry for the profits that come with agenda driven headlines? Then send your journalist to the Blame, Insinuate Accuse Seminar.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, HOST
utterances.utterance: Now, I'm going to show you some headlines and you're going tell me how you would rewrite them for maximum profit. Okay, here's the first one. "Snow storm expected to blanket North East."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: "Whites ski the rest freeze as snowstorm reveals weather inequality."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Nice. All right, here's another one. "Midwest man wins Mega Millions jackpot."

utterances.speaker: SALLY
utterances.utterance: Oh, "Man wins lottery -- No surprise to the 3.2 billion women who didn't win the lottery."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Snappy. I love it. Sally, you're a natural. All right. How about this one. "World War II vet celebrates 95th birthday."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: "Elderly white lifelong Republican voter turns 95 thanks to Russian collusion."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Nailed it. All right. Next one. "Church youth group holds bake sale for flood victims."

utterances.utterance: "House fire in Australia injure seven house."

utterances.speaker: SALLY
utterances.utterance: "House Fire in Australia injure seven only in Trump's America."

utterances.utterance: "Volcano erupts in Brazil, many injured."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: "Volcano erupts in Brazil. Many injured only in Trump's America."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, you all passed with flying colors. I am so proud of you. Now get out there and do some journalism.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's the Blame, Insinuate, Accuse Seminar -- locations everywhere. Call today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If your symptoms are chronic, he's got the tonic. Host of the radio show "Dr. Drew Midday Live," Dr. Drew Pinsky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This man really got Bin Laden to open up. Former Navy SEAL, Rob O'Neill.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is only happy when she's feeling crappy. Host of "The Tyrus and Timpf Podcast," Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And the last time he blew out birthday candles, they had to call the Fire Department, former WWE superstar, massive sidekick, host of "UnPC," Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dr. Drew, you're a doctor or so you say, I haven't actually seen your diploma. Has America turned into one big church of victimhood? What's going on? DREW PINSKY, HOST, "DR. PINSKY MIDDAY LIVE": Not only that, we have such - - we get such credibility from being a victim, people want to be a certain kind of victim so badly we're actually seeing a little epidemic of these kinds of hoaxes. They all have the same kind of construct to them, which is people want to be a victim of these things because it gives them status.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right, it's actually - for this guy it's better to be a victim than actually a being a star of a show. That's insane.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: It's strange how -- however, I've been doing a lot of thinking about this guy. He had an album dropping like a day after this whole thing, and it was all about exactly what happened to him in Chicago. And I wonder if there was something. Even he -- listen to this, even he was shocked at how crazy the media got with the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: I think that might be the case.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Rob, what's your take on this?

utterances.speaker: ROB O'NEILL, FORMER NAVY SEAL
utterances.utterance: I am a straight white kid from Beau, Montana who could probably be on the cover of "Decent Shape" magazine. So I have never -- I have never been the victim of a hate crime. I've never seen it. But for someone to -- it's one thing to screw up, which I don't think happened. It's another thing to make it happen. A hoax like this that takes away from actual hate crimes where real violence in Chicago is a problem, real people who are gay or transgender getting beat up. It's a shame because now, was this real? Or is someone making this up? And I don't think personally, he did it like they're saying for salary. I think he did this because he hated Trump so much. Maybe we can make them all racist to make people hate Trump more. It just -- I mean, it might sound ridiculous. But how ridiculous. I'm impressed that he got beat up and held on to his sandwich.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.utterance: I mean, I've been in fights before. That's the first thing I'd drop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Although I would -- I would beat them with the meat.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.utterance: Well played, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way. That can't be policed. Thank you. Kat, I'm being applauded for some strange sentence.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just - this whole thing confuses me. I love attention. Like, I love it so much that it pushes people away. However, I don't fake a racist, homophobic attack on myself love attention. Like, hasn't he heard of just like posting a selfie on Instagram? Or like starting a fight with your boyfriend? Or pretending to be pregnant? These are all better ways. Or maybe like learning to ride a unicycle because you know what? That's the only reason anyone learns to ride a unicycle, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They have invented bikes with two wheels.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true. That is true. We're going to -- don't sit -- unicycle writers, send the letters to Kat.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You're doing it for the attention, guys. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST, FOX NATION: Yes, all four of you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Smearing the unicyclists. Tyrus, what are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Besides the fact that you literally -- great monologue, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: But you certainly got really creepy in there. Literally, every time you made a great point, he slid in something creepy. Did anyone stuck on the whole, "Don't let me babysit your kids," was that a mission? A cry for help? Like, what the hell, Greg?

utterances.utterance: I hate kids.

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: That's what I am saying like he will say something like, "You know, we should all be unified together, and then unify in my basement." Like he says really creepy things.

utterances.utterance: That's my thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH

Why did he -- they mentioned salary and this whatever. And I've actually witnessed this behavior quite often in my own life in my own home. My four-year-old daughter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: She'll be running in the yard back and forth and I'll be having to do work yeah, maybe watching ESPN report on my phone or whatever. And she'll fall. Like, "Uh, Daddy my leg," and I'll be like, "Oh, what happened?" A shark.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And then will look at me and I'm like, "A shark." "And a dinosaur."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: What do we do? What do we do? "I don't know. They killed me to death." "Oh, my poor baby." And then I give her a hug, and guess what? Where's the shark? "I think they left, daddy. I think we're good now."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She just wanted to hug?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He did the [bleep] for a hug. He should have paid those guys $3,500.00 to hug on you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my god.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: Check the vinyl. This maybe a new thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We have to roll, but I do believe that it has a lot to do with naivete. The people in media right now are coming from the campus and they can't -- everybody here, Dr. Drew, Rob military, Kat libertarian, Tyrus --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Watch your mouth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus streetwise. None of you believed this story. None of you believed this story --

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: Immediately.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But stat people that work at MSNBC and CNN in their newsrooms bought it. They bought it --

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: And ran with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. All right, we've got to move on because we have so much to share with you. It's the return of the burn, and no, we're not talking about that infection I got in Mazatlan.

utterances.utterance: Can this old fella get the nomination if his beliefs are an abomination? Add Bernie Sanders to the island of crazy oddities, looking for the Democratic nomination. He's been in politics forever, and hasn't combed his hair in 35 years. Look, Bernie is a white guy in his 70s, which for the Democrats is worse than worshipping Satan. But he almost beat Hillary in the 2016 primary. So maybe he thinks he can get the nomination if she's not running. I mean, who else could do it? Kirsten Gillibrand, who's paying attention to her?

utterances.utterance: Sorry, go ahead.

It's the best -- it's the best dressing ever. And what about Joe? He told an audience in Germany that America was an embarrassment. His biggest asset is that he's only stupid. Now, the nomination could end up going to a crunchy old socialist who happens to own three homes. Yes, three homes, that's three more homes than Kat who still lives in a garage?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Damn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but it'd be fun to watch him versus Trump. What do you think Bernie?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There's a lady who is sure. All that glitters is gold. And she's buying a stairway to heaven.

utterances.utterance: When she gets there, she knows if the stores are all closed with the word she can get what she came for.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And I just love you. I want to ask just a couple of things about your early life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, and she's buying Stairway to Heaven.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: What will Democrats do now that you are responsible? And in the leadership?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There's a sign on the wall, but she wants to be sure because, you know, sometimes words have two meanings.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There are so many people who say young people are only activists, because they are millennials who are idealistic and think it is cool.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I believe, I have gas. Oh, I never should have had that three-bean salad, always comes back. Why not just have two beans, always the three beans. Oh, my God. I hope that's just gas. Maybe they'll think Pelosi did it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, Rob --

utterances.speaker: O'NEILL
utterances.utterance: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Does he still have the Mojo that he had in 2016?

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.utterance: Well, everyone is trying to get on board with the socialism thing because they put their name in front of Democratic socialism, which is a bunch of nonsense, too, but I am just saying they were bragging about what? $8 million a few minutes when he announced his candidacy. He better be given 70% of the Trump campaign because let's share the wealth a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.utterance: You know what I am saying? That's what it is all about, and like the $300,000.00 on private airfare last month. It's easy to be a socialist when you're living like a capitalist, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's the only way to do it. What do you think, Kat, as a libertarian? Are you scared that this could - we could have a socialist President/

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Well, I love Bernie supporters. They're like, "I will not rest until every business in the country has zero dollars." I'm sick of it. I'm sick of the Democratic socialist acting like they're so altruistic, like, "Oh, look at us. We want to give you this, you want to give you this, we want to give you this. Not like those mean Republicans. No. They want it you to be sick, and they want you to be hungry. And then they want to kill your grandma. And then they want you to die after you watch grandma die." It's like, no, in order to give you something, you have to actually own that first. They're not giving away their own stuff, right? If your boyfriend takes you out to dinner, and buys you a present ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: O' NEILL
utterances.utterance: Which happens only now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You would probably be very happy unless you found out that he used your credit card to pay for it --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Which is only acceptable if you are nine and that person is your mother, and you made it on construction paper or whatever. But no, it's -- I'm sick of them pretending that it's about generosity. It's not about generosity. It's about control. It's about big government. And it's about taking from people not giving.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, the illusion is that government services are free and the socialists are actually giving it to you when in fact it's taking from the free market.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's deep. That's great, Greg. The illusion is the media and they go back -- America does not walk around trying to be victims. We talked about it about earlier. The media is painting victims and expect the American people to buy into it and the Smollett thing just prove that we're still not buying that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Bernie Sanders is a legit contender despite CNN and the other left leaning media's best efforts. They are pitching this magnificent Group of Seven young candidates who are coming in. And then Bernie announced and raised $6 million in 24 hours. Then they said, well, let's list how much the other guys made. Kamala, not bad. It took her about a week, she got about $2 million. So she's strong. After that. About $6.00 or $7.00, $16.00. I think Pocahontas owes money. And that goes against their message. It was supposed to be this new left because that's the only way they feel that they can. So you watch how this goes down. This is going to be a boring time for President Trump and I don't know if he is going to be able to handle it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because they're going to be going after Bernie Sanders for everything because he's not what they want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And that's going to be the fun story is how they keep throwing things at Bernie though, all kinds of little stories going to leak about him. There's going to be all these anonymous tips about Bernie's behaviors. And maybe there's a fourth house out there we don't know about. A little bastard house somewhere. I mean, a little cabin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The fourth house in his hair, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Maybe he is out with Greg Gutfeld on weekends. Like we don't, we don't know. But I guarantee you there's going to be some stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did meet him at a party.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've got to get to Dr. Drew. Last word on this.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: In two years, old white male becomes completely a non-contender. Just being an old white male.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would say no. I would say no.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.utterance: No, I'm saying, he was a contender two years ago. Two years goes by, just being an old white male takes him out. That's it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It's against their religion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Up next. What kind of nicknames will Trump have for 2020 candidates? Stick around and we pretend to have answers. That's next.

utterances.speaker: ANITA VOGEL, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Anita Vogel. Billionaire Warren Buffett telling shareholders in its annual letter Saturday to continue betting on the American economy. Buffett says his company, Berkshire Hathaway, has prospered by doing just that. He says, he hasn't found any major deals at attractive prices lately, which is why Berkshire Hathaway currently has about $130 billion in cash and short-term investments. Buffett's letter is always well-read in the business world because of this remarkable track record. Two top Defense officials taking a tour of the U.S.-Mexico border Saturday. Acting Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan and Joint Chiefs Chairman, General Joseph Dunford getting a close-up look of a stretch of the 18-foot border wall, as well as Border Patrol vehicles used for surveillance. Shanahan also test fired a couple of weapons including a plastic one. I'm Anita Vogel. Now back to "Greg Gutfeld."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's the unwanted fame have a Trump nickname. The "Associated Press" is reporting President Trump is working on labels for the 2020 candidates and it's testing them out on advisers before he reveals them publicly. I'm so excited. New nicknames. It's like waiting for a rich relative to die. I know, I don't feel really that good about it, but there is that payoff. Let's remember some of his most memorable monikers.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: I've given my answer Lying Ted, I've given my answer. Jeb Bush is a low-energy person. More energy tonight, I like that. Crooked Hillary. She is Crooked Hillary Clinton. Don't worry about Little Marco. I've got more Indian blood in me than Pocahontas. Sleepy Joe Biden. Crazy Bernie. Da Nang Dick. Lying Ted. Lying Ted. What's your name? My name is Lying Ted Cruz. I never attack him on his look, and believe, there's plenty of subject matter right there. That I can tell you.
